DOC.detailed_description: In collaboration University Iowa , Palmer Center Chiropractic Research pursue follow specific aim : 1 ) To determine immediate pre-to-post change HVLA-SM LVVA-SM lumbo-pelvic region , compare control group receive light effleurage sham mechanically assisted adjustment , sensorimotor function measure : lumbo-pelvic repositioning ability , stand postural sway , response sudden trunk loading ; 2 ) To determine effect 2 week ( 4 application @ 2 per week ) HVLA-SM LVVA-SM lumbo-pelvic region , compare control group receive light effleurage sham mechanically assisted adjustment , sensorimotor function measure : lumbo-pelvic repositioning ability , stand postural sway response sudden trunk loading ; 3 ) To determine effect 6 week ( 12 application @ 2 per week ) HVLA-SM LVVA-SM lumbo-pelvic region sensorimotor function measure : Lumbo-pelvic repositioning ability , stand postural sway , response sudden truck loading ; 4 ) To explore whether change sensorimotor function associate change self-reported back pain intensity , related disability , health status 2 week ( 4 SM Visits ) 6 week ( 12 SM Visits ) ; 5 ) To determine sensorimotor function change great patient priori clinically classified appropriate manipulation . ; 6 ) Describe sensorimotor clinical effect 4 week full spine extremity ( clinician 's choice ) care follow 2 week receive light effleurage sham mechanically assist adjustment participant low back pain ; 7 ) To explore association : a. DC characterization quality SM ( rat survey ) biomechanics SM ( measure force-time profile , biomechanical assessment , videotape ) , b. DC participant characterization quality SM ( rat survey ) .
DOC.criteria: 21 65 year old Low back pain ( LBP ) score 11 point numerical rating scale : ( must > 4 Phone Screening OR Baseline 1 Visit ) AND ( must > 2 Phone Screen , Baseline 1 AND Baseline 2 Visits ) Acute ( less 7 day ) , subacute ( 7 day 7 week ) , chronic ( 7 week ) LBP match classification 1 , 2 , 3 Quebec Task Force ( QTF ) Classification system QTF 1 : Pain without radiation , QTF 2 : Pain + radiation proximal extremity , QTF 3 : Pain + radiation distal extremity , QTF 7 : Spinal stenosis Written inform consent ( ICD1 , ICD2 ICD3 ) Ongoing treatment low back pain health care provider unwillingness postpone use type manual treatment LBP except provide study ( include chiropractic osteopathic SM , physical therapy massage ) duration study period . Comorbidities Bleeding Disorders Bone Joint Pathology Cauda Equina Syndrome Contraindication spinal manipulation , general Current Pending Litigation General Poor Health Inflammatory Destructive tissue change spine Neuromuscular Diseases Obesity Osteoporosis Peripheral Neuropathies Spinal Surgery Suspicion drug alcohol abuse Uncontrolled hypertension Vascular claudication Quebec Task Force ( QTF ) Spinal Disorders QTF 4 : Pain + radiation upper/lower limb neurologic sign QTF 5 : Presumptive compression spinal nerve root simple roentgenogram QTF 6 : Compression spinal nerve root confirm specific image technique QTF 8 : Postsurgical status , 16 month intervention QTF 9 : Postsurgical status , > 6 month intervention 9.1 : Asymptomatic 9.2 : Symptomatic QTF 10 : Chronic pain syndrome QTF 11 : Other diagnosis Pregnant nursing woman Pacemaker Inability read verbally comprehend English Any Joint Replacement Use spinal manipulation within past 4 week . If participant willing delay study enrollment four week post spinal manipulative therapy , schedule accordingly criterion meet Sensitivity tape use biomechanical assessment If Study Clinician believe diagnostic procedure xrays dipstick urinalysis necessary diagnose participant 's condition , participant exclude Beck Depression InventoryII great equal 29 Retention legal advice open pending case healthrelated condition
